content: 5 times 20 r18 single_crochet 3 increase 5 times 25 r19 single_crochet in each stitch around 25 r20 single_crochet 4 increase 5 times 30 r21-23 single_crochet in each stitch around 30 r24 single_crochet 4 decrease 5 times 25 r25 single_crochet in each stitch around 25 r26 single_crochet 3 decrease 5 times 20 stuff the body but do not stuff the neck continue stuffing as you complete the body in the next row r27 single_crochet in each stitch around 20 r28 single_crochet 2 decrease 5 times 15 r29-31 single_crochet in each stitch around 15 r32 single_crochet 1 decrease 5 times 10 r33 decrease 5 times 5 slip_stitch and fasten_off leaving a short tail to sew the last 5 stitches together @crochetbyghosts 5 leg begin with yellow yarn r1 single_crochet 4 in a magic_ring 4 r2 increase in each stitch around 8 r3 bobble increase single_crochet 1 increase 2 times 12 r4 single_crochet in each stitch around 12 r5 decrease single_crochet 4 2 times 10 r6 decrease single_crochet 3 2 times 8 r7-10 single_crochet in each stitch around 8 r11 single_crochet 2 decrease 2 times 6 r12 single_crochet in each stitch around 6 change color to white yarn r13 in flo increase single_crochet 1 increase 2 times 10 @crochetbyghosts 6 slip_stitch into the first white stitch and continue in the round r14-15 single_crochet in each stitch around 10 do not stuff the leg we are going to slip_stitch the leg close before sewing before we begin single_crochet 2 or adjust accordingly to shift the hook so that it is at the side of the leg slip your hook into the front loop of the next stitch as well as the front loop of the third-last stitch you made make a slip_stitch continue to slip_stitch top and bottom stitches together 3 more times until the wing is closed fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing @crochetbyghosts 7 wing use white yarn r1 single_crochet 5 in magic_ring 5 r2 increase in each stitch around 10 r3 single_crochet in each stitch around 10 r4 increase single_crochet 4 2 times 12 r5-6 single_crochet in each stitch around 12 r7 decrease single_crochet 4 2 times slip_stitch into the next stitch do not fasten_off 10 do not stuff the wing similar to the legs we are going to slip_stitch the wing close before sewing slip your hook into the front loop of the next stitch as well as the front loop of the third-last stitch you made make a slip_stitch continue to slip_stitch top and bottom stitches together 3 more times until the wing is closed fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing we are almost done @crochetbyghosts 8 assembly wings starting from the first white row at the beak count to the 14th white row position both wings on either side of the body approximately 12 stitches apart sew through the slip_stitch legs flip over magic_ring goose starting from the first white row at the beak count to the 23rd row position both legs so
